intro: Ouratea itineraria, commonly known as the Brazilian holly or the yellow holly, is a flowering plant native to the Atlantic rainforests of Brazil. It is a member of the Ochnaceae family and is characterized by its evergreen leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 6 meters. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and have a glossy dark green surface. The fruit is a capsule that contains several seeds, which are dispersed by wind or animals.
